entries.meaning: A strong desire; an itch to do something.
examples: After seeing the advert for a soft drink, I had a sudden urge to buy a bottle.

verbs.description: urge (third-person singular simple present urges, present participle urging, simple past and past participle urged)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To press; to push; to drive; to impel; to force onward.
(transitive) To put mental pressure on; to ply with motives, arguments, persuasion, or importunity.
examples: My boss urged me to reconsider my decision to leave the company, even offering a pay rise.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To press hard upon; to follow closely.
examples: Man ? and for ever ? wretch ! what wouldst thou have ? / Heir urges heir, like wave impelling wave.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To present in an urgent manner; to insist upon.
examples: to urge an argument; to urge the necessity of a case

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To treat with forcible means; to take severe or violent measures with.
examples: to urge an ore with intense heat

entries.meaning: (transitive) To be pressing in argument; to insist; to persist.
